revised_title: A Method for Coloring Marble with a Picture that Penetrates the Stone
tldr: The author describes a method of preparing a liquid that can penetrate and color marble, allowing a picture drawn on the surface to appear throughout the stone. The process involves using a mixture of chemicals, including aqua fortis, aqua regis, sal armoniack, and spirit of wine, to create colored waters that can be applied to the marble. The resulting colored picture can be seen on both sides of the stone when cut, and has been tested and verified by experienced craftsmen.
